title: The tank items update as it stands won't make juggernauts feel good at all
body:
Increase in resistances, lowering of HP.

Randuins pretty much getting dumpstered.

I wouldn't mind us juggernauts being forced back towards steraks, but steraks as it stands right now is such a shitty item to build compared to the other things on live patch.

We can't use one of the new items because it gives massive tank at the cost of dealing 2/5 damage during the tankiness stage. The other tank item is decent against magic damage dealers I guess. We won't swap to abyssal except for maybe mordekaiser who might be the only one coming out of the update happy with that particular change.

replies.body:
Tbh, I think that's part of the goal. Separating out tank vs. juggernaut itemization is something that is good for the game, in the long run. I think it's good that they get it out of the way. 

Balance problems ALWAYS arise when they tweak stuff, but the game USUALLY comes out better for it in the long run. Generally.

> [{quoted}](name=KempyreanPirate,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xzpx38K3,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2017-04-07T02:27:41.562+0000)
>
> Tbh, I think that's part of the goal.

its really not.

the goal is to prevent bruiser assassins who keep resurfacing, and  divers like {{champion:120}} who become damage/tankyness threats on the level of juggernauts while being highly mobile.

juggernauts are designed to become lategame raidbosses who rely on high health builds while dealing massive amounts of damage. they are supposed to get really fucking tanky while dealing lots of damage.

the goal they officially set for juggs back then was being able to stack around 4k health and around 250 ad. this is neccessary for them because theyre made to be fully effective by walking into the enemy team. and they lack the ability to evade aoe burst damage such as {{champion:21}} or {{champion:9}} ultimates.

their kits are all around designed to scale with health more than resistances. so cutting off another 300 health from their builds after the 300 to 500 in season 6, is a huge hit.
Mmh... but juggernauts didn't lose health in their builds. They are supposed to build Cleaver, Sterak, Mallet, Titanic, Warmog, none of these items has been nerfed.

> [{quoted}](name=Fefnil,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xzpx38K3,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2017-04-07T11:13:25.833+0000)
>
> Mmh... but juggernauts didn't lose health in their builds. They are supposed to build Cleaver, Sterak, Mallet, Titanic, Warmog, none of these items has been nerfed.

first of all, all of these have received health nerfes in season 6 already during the era of bruiser assassins.

it was a knee jerk reaction to yasuo, fiora, graves and even adc and assassins building some of these items to become tanky skirmishers and to bcome immune to burst.

second, dead mans plate was released as a juggernaut item and not a tank item. right now it is mainly built on fighters and only secondary on tanks, and shouldnt even be grouped into the tank item changes.

considering that juggernauts are also are expected to build and that they are building items like {{item:3742}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3083}} {{item:3068}} , they did indeed lose health. even if you just build one or two of these items on a juggernaut, it adds up to a massive health nerf combined to what they already cut off in season 6.

About Deadman's Plate that's true, it started as a Juggernaut item, but Riot changed its mind and has been slowly turning it into a tank item. Juggernauts are not supposed and were never expected to build Randuin's or Sunfire. They did because they could and because meta demanded it, but they shouldn't have done. This actually forced Riot to keep Juggernauts undertuned in relation with their class items.
A Juggernaut needs to be tanky, but what does tanky mean? It ultimately leads to effective health, which means health multiplied by resistance. You have two ways to improve it: you either gain health or you gain resistances.
With these changes Riot wants to remark this: tanks are supposed to build resistances, and be stronger against sustained damage. Juggernauts, instead, are supposed to build health (even if this means staying with less than 100/150 resistances) and be resistant to burst (Sterak's Gage also magnifying this). They still are tanky, but need to quickly focus and kill a dps carry, while they outsustain the burst ones.
Try building only the supposed items on Juggernauts. Maybe they will feel different or maybe undertuned, but this only means that Riot can now balance them accordingly, without Juggernauts abusing items from other classes.

there was no issue with tanks building dead mans plate on occation, but the item is and should still remain a fighter item first and foremost.

its the same they did with cleaver by making it heavily ad focused and nerfing its health with the marksmen update, even though the item wasnt fucking meant for adc to be built or used, and designed as a core item for juggs and a situational item for assassins.

because for some reaosn they always tunnel vision when it comes to item changes.

steraks bought by adc and assassins a problem? nerf the item without compensating juggs.

titanic hydra bought by skirmishers? nerf the item then change the skirmisher to not scale with it anymore and dont revert the change.

Juggernaut, instead, are supposed to build health (even if this means staying with less then 100/150 resistances) and be resistant to burst (Sterak's Gage also magnifying this). 

and theyre showing that by nerfing health on basically every source of health in the game, including juggernaut items?

thats my entire point. you cant just balance tank and jugg itemization in a vacuum. juggernauts are expected to build items like wamogs or occationally randuins to complement their builds.

because working entirely without resistance items doesnt fucking work for them. 

and if you make these items less viable for them, then at least leave juggs with alternatives to survive and dont just remove options.

> riot just does what they always do when they do item changes and class updates. they fuck around with items that are bought by certain champions, even when these items arent meant for these champions, and are core items to an entirely different class.

No, the explanation is simpler: they are humans. When they created the Juggernaut as a class, they had everything in mind, and did the itemization accordingly, but they didn't consider existing tank items, especially because they are very old and are thus too much "generic". So people started doing things Riot wasn't expecting, things they shouldn't. They failed because it was the first time, and with the time they slowly tried to fix these mistakes, even though this led to other mistakes because they still needed to do patchly balancing.

> there was no issue with tanks building dead mans plate on occation, but the item is and should still remain a fighter item first and foremost.

Maybe they don't like it as a fighter item. Every tanky item with cc is already a tank item, so maybe they thought is would be better to make it a rule and shifting Deadman's to a tank item. The last patch did this: it completely removed the dps "potential" of the Deadman's, and made it a "one hit once in a while" item. Also they shifted all this power into the cc, the slow.

> its the same they did with cleaver by making it heavily ad focused and nerfing its health with the marksmen update, even though the item wasnt fucking meant for adc to be built or used, and designed as a core item for juggs.
> 
> because for some reaosn they always tunnel vision when it comes to item changes.
> 
> steraks bought by adc and assassins a problem? nerf the item without compensating juggs.
> 
> titanic hydra bought by skirmishers? nerf the item then change the skirmisher to not scale with it anymore and dont revert the change.

All of this still falls under the category "temporal solutions until I figure out what to do". I'm not a professional, I don't know how to balance things properly, so I can't say if they're doing right or wrong. But they still must follow some guide lines, and this also means they are bound to them. Maybe they can't do everything we ask because for them it's not  so simple.

> and theyre showing that by nerfing health on basically every source of health in the game, including juggernaut items?

None of the juggernaut items (which looks like are the class meant to stack health) has nerfed health on the pbe. If they did it during the past year, it doesn't matter: they were just band aids. Now they are marking tanky itemization, so it's now that you have to consider. And none of the items a juggernaut should build has health nerfed.

> thats my entire point. you cant just balance tank and jugg itemization in a vacuum. juggernauts are expected to build items like wamogs or occationally randuins to complement their builds.
> 
> and if you make these items less viable for them, then at least leave juggs with alternatives and dont just remove options.

The options are there. They are undertuned because other classes abused them, and because juggernauts abused tank items. One step at a time. Now they are taking away the tank items. I'm pretty sure in time we'll see changes to juggernauts to counterbalance the loss of these items.

Mallet is shit

Cleaver and titanic is almost always one or the other, the only one who builds both isn't even a juggernaut {{champion:58}} 

Warmog is worthless 

Juggernauts do not abuse items.
Imo Mundo does...mainly cause Mundo.

mundo is just a shit design, we all know this

Juggernauts are intended to build tank items for survivability though
That's true, but it can lead to the issue that juggernauts become more tanky than tanks. Riot wants tanks to be the most tanky class.

tanks will be more durable up front  due to shields and resist boosts etc

most juggernaut defenses are based in their sustain which is easy to counter, and Steraks which only Illaoi still likes to build

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xzpx38K3,comment-id=0006000000000001000100000000,timestamp=2017-04-07T13:30:52.368+0000)
>
> That's true, but it can lead to the issue that juggernauts become more tanky than tanks. Riot wants tanks to be the most tanky class.

Not true, riot wants both classes to be equally tanky, juggernauts can outtank tanks heavily through certain sustain mechanicisms while tanks usually have dumbass tank steroids that you just press a key to get without having to do actual work.

What is supposed to define these two classes is that tanks have conditional mobility in certain cases, universally have way better cc, but juggernauts have way better damage and never have conditional mobility unless if you consider olaf's tenacity potential as mobility. Juggernauts only ever get speed boosts.

http://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/2017/01/dev-state-of-champion-update-january-2017/

Supporting language of this goes as far back as when they first decided to name the subclasses

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/gameplay/dev-blog-classes-subclasses

I skimmed your entire thread debate with Fefnil, but I can't stomach getting that specific about particular items.

Reality is, they ARE trying to make certain items more attractive to certain classes, and the items that are being worked on are not INTENDED for juggernauts. You might be right that juggernauts will suffer because of the changes; where you and I disagree is whether or not that's particularly relevant to the discussion.

As I already said, 

> Balance problems ALWAYS arise when they tweak stuff, but the game USUALLY comes out better for it in the long run. Generally.

Part of the reason that the juggernaut rework didn't go that well is that they had tank items to fall back on, which prevented the items for juggernauts being a great lever to pull to adjust balance. This update has big potential to fix that. IF IT DOES, then they can safely buff some juggernaut items and keep monitoring. 

I care most about the long term benefits on the changes, and I think they are probably hitting the mark there. But you aren't wrong. If I worked at Riot, I would keep a close eye on Juggs and divers for this update. But creating real differences between tank and jugg itemization can only be good in the long run. 

That's a debate I'm much more interested in having that whatever tangent you and Fefnil got on to.

It feels... okay, honestly. At least, Visage and DMP feel pretty alright, with the latter giving us the stacks faster so we can use it more often.

The higher resistances give us a pretty good EHP, but I do resent the fairly large drop in raw health. Especially given that it's another direct hit to Sterak's itself when it relies on us having a fat health pool.

I think Sterak's should get a big buff and a price raise to make it worth our while. I only get it on Illaoi these days when I would love to have it on almost all of them.
The major issue being, if they buff steraks wrong, other classes (marksmen/assassins) will start building it again.

Easily solved by shifting the ratio to bonus health. 

 Now either of them have to give up more damage for a stronger shield.

will true damage get nerfed in response?

My favorite way to play Illaoi is going full draintank, and I think I'd have a blast being in my ult with 7k hp.  Probably not viable because she needs damage, but It would turn her from a Kraken priestess into full Kraken since she has % missing hp scalings regardless of damage.

I like most of the changes, but I really would like an anti-adc type of resistances like current randuins, I don't want to see that crit reduction go.

Depending on how Riot manages the "You do less damage" aspect of the item, it could apply to % missing HP (and theoretically true damage) as well.

Essentially if the item takes the "Damage you would deal" number and reduces that before applying it to the target, it could affect any (and all) damage dealt during the duration.  Which I feel is in the spirit of the item.

She'd definitely deal less damage from all sources, but even if her tents are hitting for 50 damage she's going to heal for 5% missing health for every tent slap.  The item increases current and maximum health by a percentage, preventing it from being like a lulu ult, but it still greatly affects champs with max health healing.  If Illaoi is really low health during her ult, she can pop the active and double her healing.  Say 5 tents hit champions and she has 300/3000 health, she would normally heal 675, but the item doubles it to 1350, and the way I build her I always take {{item:3812}} {{item:3065}} and that increased healing mastery, making that healing go upwards of 1822.  There's no bursting through that kind of healing when it's on a 1.2 second cooldown and she has more than 200 armor/mr.
